definitions.definition: a person who gives money and support to artists and writers

examples.text: Frederick the Great was the patron of many artists.
He was a great patron of the arts and helped to establish the Baltimore Museum.

definitions.definition: a famous person who supports an organization such as a charity and whose name is used in the advertisements, etc. for the organization

examples.text: the official patron of the college
The Princess of Wales is patron of the Royal Photographic Society.

definitions.definition: a person who uses a particular shop, restaurant, etc.

examples.text: The car park is for the use of patrons only.

wordOrigin: Middle English: from Old French, from Latin patronus ‘protector of clients, defender’, from pater, patr- ‘father’.
